content.description: Go straight up the middle of the slab to the anchors. The bulge in the first 8 feet is the crux, with a balancy mantle.
content.protection: This route is best TR'd, as there is thin to no pro for the first 15 feet, and the ledge below would make for an unpleasant landing.
content.location: Right in the middle of the slab.

content.description: From below the bulge in the center of the wall, head up the right leaning crack to a small tree. From here, follow the thin left leaning crack to the anchors.
content.location: This is the rightmost route on the Beginner Slab.

content.description: Fun crack system that shares an anchor with Slabtastic and Simply Frayed.
content.protection: Mid to small pro, nothing larger than a BD #2.
content.location: Nice easy crack on the left side of the beginner slab. You can start it from the same ledge as Slabtastic and Simply Frayed, or add another 15 feet by starting at the base of The Cracks area.

content.description: Great for taking first timers out! There are three distinct routes here that share an anchor with rap rings. The anchors can be accessed from the Plunge overlook above.
